6850/A0/03/004/013.status_value: At the end of September 2014  18.35% (435/2348) of HIV-exposed infants were tested for HIV in the first 2 months of life. EID is a challenging for the national program  more than 80% of HIV exposed infants don't have access to PCR  the blood samples collected for PCR is often of poor quality (sometimes unusable and/or insufficient in quantity). The time between the blood sample collected and PCR results communication exceed 3 months in average  less than 10% of HIV exposed infants are started on
6850/A0/03/004/013.indicator_name: % of HIV-exposed infants tested for HIV in the first 2 months of life

6850/A0/03/004/013.status_value: 24.49% (575/2348) of HIV-exposed infants under aged 1 were test to HIV by PCR.

6850/A0/03/006/004.status_value: The KAP study on cholera prevention in the regions of Quinara and Tombali  as well as the study on behavior changes with respect to hygiene practices in schools and communities  and the study on Parental behavior  are in the final stages. The anthropologist study on the behavior of mothers about breastfeeding and feeding of the child is in the final stages of preparation.  RESEN Updated and validation planned for 2015 prior to publication.
6850/A0/03/006/004.indicator_name: Number of KAP surveys conducted and reported

6850/A0/03/006/004.status_value: INE technical staff  coordinated all the work of the questionnaire. Survey Staff has been identified and trained. All technical documents with the budget and the timetable were elaborated  the questionnaires were translated into Portuguese  discussed and agreed with all technical ministries (health  education  justice  water resources). Technical materials were purchased for the survey  cartography  sampling and the pilot study  training of 85 interviewers and 30 agents for data entry  collectio
6850/A0/03/006/004.indicator_name: Number of MICS surveys conducted and reported.

6850/A0/03/006/004.status_value: The report on the SMART/nutrition survey was translated from French into Portuguese  both versions of the report were disseminated to Government  UN Agencies  NGOs partners and other financial and technical partners . The same report  was also sent to donors in order to mobilize more funds to combat malnutrition among children and women of reproductive age. It was this study results that lead to the conduction of an anthropological study on the families feeding practices of children and women.
6850/A0/03/006/004.indicator_name: Number of Smart surveys conducted and reported

6850/A0/03/006/004.status_value: The SITAN is being prepared and a first draft is already available for programmes comments and suggestions.  Field Data-gathering from the communities as well as the implementing partners was conducted. Final document expected during the first quarter of 2015  which will be the support for preparation of new UNDAF/CPD (2016-2020).
6850/A0/03/006/004.indicator_name: Number of SITAN updates and complete SITANS conducted.

6850/A0/03/006/004.status_value: The Data base Guinea-BissauInfo data has been updated with three data sources  ' MICS/2010 and 2014  SMART/2012` and disseminated on the web page of Guinea-BissauInfo. Internment in the country  the Web page was spread in universities (Lusophone  and Jean Piaget) as well as in the center of Administrative Training (ENDA) and the National Institute of Public Health (INASA). Dissemination of these actions  attended by 500 people (Students  Teachers and Researchers). In addition to the spread  also

6850/A0/03/006/004.indicator_name: 80% d'indicateurs calcules sur les informations de qualité

6850/A0/03/006/004.status_value: La version du SITAN pour le plaidoyer est finalisée et disponible
L'enquête MICS-4 réalisée et le rapport est disponible
6850/A0/03/006/004.indicator_name: Réalisation systématique de l'enquête MICS  chaque 3 année

6850/A0/03/006/004.status_value: La collecte des données pour les deux enquêtes SMART (Nutrition et MILDA)  est terminée. À ce stade  les équipe sont entraient de procéder à la saisi et l'analyse des données provenant des deux enquêtes. En principe  les deux rapports seront prêts en janvier 2013.
6850/A0/03/006/004.indicator_name: Réalisation des enquêtes Smart pour avoir des informations statistiques plus actualises

6850/A0/03/006/004.status_value: Malheureusement l'étude de CAP sur les droits des femmes et des filles dans les régions de Bafatá  Gabu  Oio et Bolama  n'as pas était réaliser cette année. La principale cause est le manque des bureaux spécialisés dans les études de genre en Guinée-Bissau  par ailleurs comment on ne peut pas utiliser des fonds de l'UE pour les institutions de l'état  l'étude sera planifiée pour l'année prochaine 2013.
6850/A0/03/006/004.indicator_name: Réalisation des études CAP pour avoir des informations statistiques plus actualises sur les comportements de la communiste et surtout des enfante et des femmes

6850/A0/03/006/004.status_value: Regarding the MICS-5 survey  the preliminary report was produced  and disseminated as well as a summary sheet of the main results of the survey. The two documents relating to the MICS-5  served to support fund-raising during the round table organized by the Guinea-Bissau Government in Brussels as were the only indicators that the parents presented for evaluation of the MDGs .

6850/A0/04/887/004.indicator_name: Number of Reviews undertaken during the Year
6850/A0/04/887/004.headline: Three studies were successfully conducted in 2016 generating evidence for children and the recent Multiple Indicators Cluster Survey (MICS 5) was officially launched and dissiminated.

6850/A0/04/887/003.status_value: the Country Office exerted to identify a Social Policy Chief  in order to lead the delivery of social policy priorities.
6850/A0/04/887/003.indicator_name: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy
6850/A0/04/887/003.headline: UNICEF exerted efforts in strenghening its internal capacity to effectively support the development of social protection in Guinea-Bissau  and initiated a dialogue with stakeholders  including the Government and the World Bank  on the need for coordinated actions towards the establishment of a coherent policy framework for social protection

6850/A0/04/887/003.indicator_name: 90% (of the 35% allocated) of the national budget allocated to education  health and WASH is available for use by government ministries for more inclusive social protection and resilience systems nationwide

6850/A0/04/883/003.indicator_name: Water and sanitation policy validated. Norms and standards for wash in schools  urban settings and rural settings drafted  finalized and rolled out.
6850/A0/04/883/003.headline: With UNICEF support  WASH coordination between the Government and partners has been effective  including at the regional level  while the sector has been undergoing major transformation towards the development of evidence based and business driven interventions  however the new sector policies validation process could not be completed.

6850/A0/04/883/003.indicator_name: National WASH cluster (GAS) is functioning and meets on a monthly basis chaired by DGRH.

6850/A0/03/001/012.status_value: Dissemination of GBV law (especially FGM/C) to traditional and religious leaders. A total of 120 communities and 410 people were reached in 4 regions of the country (Gabu  Bafata Tombali  Oio). For the first time in the country  7 cases of FGMC were reported and followed by the judicial system. One case was convicted.

6850/A0/03/004/014.status_value: The MICS-5 was done in 2014. Now they are conducting the analyze of data. In the first quarter we will have access to MICS-data. But according to the routine data  18486 pregnant women aged 15-24 (43.7% of all pregnant women received on ANC)  were tested to HIV and received their results  among them 2.5% were HIV+. On Sentinel Survey among pregnant women  the HIV prevalence was 3.9% (58/1489). 129 pregnant women under 15 were received on ANC and none was HIV+.

6850/A0/04/883/002.indicator_name: Communities certified free of open defecation in the reporting year only as a result of UNICEF direct support
6850/A0/04/883/002.headline: The mapping of 4 147 water-points  using smartphones  revealed that only 49% of the pump were functioning  illustrating the need to re-focus from drilling to maintenance  the reverification of Open Defecation Free communities through the visit to 5 000 households  demonstrated that 82% of these still had access to a toilet.

6850/A0/04/885/002.indicator_name: A Child Protection Policy developed and approved.
6850/A0/04/885/002.headline: With UNICEF support to improve legislative framework  the roadmap for the development of the Child Protection Code was developed and a interministerial piloting committee was officially appointed  also  final validation of regulatory instruments for alternative care took place and documents will be submitted to the Cabinet in early 2017.

6850/A0/04/881/002.indicator_name: Community Health Workers trained to implement integrated community case management (% of actually trained against the planned)
6850/A0/04/881/002.headline: UNICEF continued to expand Integrated Community Case Management (iCCM) through a network of 2 056 CHWs  which has now been extended to all health regions. UNICEF supported the national immunization campaign against meningitis and reinforced routine immunization activities for hard-to-reach children. The national Every New Born Action plan has been finalized.

6850/A0/03/001/016.indicator_name: % of boys and girls U5 registered.

6850/A0/03/001/016.status_value: 184 communities from Oio  Cacheu and Quinara regions have implemented community BR initiatives. Quinara region was covered in all the 4 sectors with a strong C4D component  including community radios involvement. In Bissau capital city  the pilot initiative in 4 neighborhoods had an enormous impact in mobilizing families and on increasing service access.
2 BR units established in Health facilities and 58 CFS conducting pre-birth registration
